name: Slowpoke
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2x2 Slowpoke every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
This stage wants you to test out Mega
Sableye's Ability. Really easy since
you are carrying 4 SE Pokemons
and one of them is Crowd Control
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left
Easy to S-Rank

name: Azurill
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Azurill
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
Low Hit Points and easy disruption. 
Really easy to beat
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Another easy to S-Rank

name: Riolu
disruptions:
Board: Metal Blocks on 1st, 6th Column
           and 6th row
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a Row of Metal Blocks after 5
          turns.
          Adds 4 Metal Blocks after 2 turns. 
          Repeat.
clearingStrategy:
Pretty hard for a low level. Metal
Blocks will be removed in 5 turns so
focus on comboing and Mega evolving
(Kangaskhan or Audino prefered here)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Skip S-Ranking it for now. Come back
when you have stronger pokemons

name: Swablu
disruptions:
Board: Swablu and Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
At 1 turn left, the Metal Blocks will
disappear killing itself
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Bring Swablu here if you must. Although
strong Super Effective Pokemons can do
this

name: Surskit
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Just bring stronger Super Effectives here

name: Taillow
disruptions:
Board: 6 Taillow in a Zigzag Pattern on 2nd
           and 3rd Row
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
You can bring Taillow here.
Surely you'll S-Rank it
the first time

name: Meowth
disruptions:
Board: 3 Coins in 3 corner
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a Coin every 3 turns

Note: Disruption is different on Mobile
clearingStrategy:
You are first introduced to coins here.
Match them if you want. This is an
easy stage

For more information on how to farm
the coins on that stage, refer to the
"Special" tab in this sheet or the 
different guides on the subreddit.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
You'll be back here for a couple of times
and a lot of that time, you'll eventually
S-Rank it
notes:
The only place to Grind Coins. You
can get up to 530 coins here

name: Croagunk
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal Blocks
Timer: Adds a Column of Metal Blocks
          every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Seems to places the entire column of
blocks on the sides only. Not really
hard to clear
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Come back later with stronger pokemons
if you have trouble

name: Corsola
clearingStrategy:
No Disruptions. Just beat it with
combo
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Another easy to S-Rank

name: Marill
disruptions:
Board: All is in Barrier except 3rd Row
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: Adds a Barrier if you dont combo
clearingStrategy:
Your best bet is match D3 (the only
Kangaskhan in row 3) to F3 (last
Nidoran in 3rd row). This will make
a 4 hit combo. Then match A3 and F3

You can also try matching B3 and D3
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 1 move left
Clearing strategy will S-Rank this

name: Mudkip
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal Blocks at the center
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Mudkips after every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
The Blocks will be removed after 5
turns and isnt a problem.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Get stronger pokemons

name: Vulpix
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 5 Vulpix
Timer: Adds 5 Vupix after every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Just do some combos. The Vulpix are
not that hard
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Relatively easy because of 3 Pokemon
limit

name: Lapras
disruptions:
Board: 3 Barriers in 5th Row and All tiles in
           Barrier in 6th row
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Barrier every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Still not that hard. Just do your best
combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Not that hard to S-Rank. Otherwise, train
up a bit

name: Pidgeotto
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Pidgeotto every 3 turns
clearingStrategy: Another easy stage. Not much to say
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
You have too much moves here

name: Mega Slowbro
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Slowpoke
Timer: Adds 3 Slowpoke every
                          3 turns

Notes: Disruption mostly affects top rows

Half Health: Adds a Column of Barrier every
                  2 turns
clearingStrategy:
You have a Super Effective Mega and
a Super Effective Crowd Control.
Not much to say here. Just do combos
and eventually it will fall. Also make
sure to get rid of Barriers when needed
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Easy even with just M-Sableye

A Mega Gengar Team will do this good.
notes:
4th Mega Stone. Although you
cant use it yet
